titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2260) to amend the Controlled Substances Act to promote pain management and palliative care without permitting assisted suicide and euthanasia, and for other purposes.

action.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2260 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Makes in order as an original bill the amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the bill as modified by the amendments recommended by the Committee on Commerce and printed in the bill. Makes in order only those amendments printed in H. Rept. 106-409.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-409, by Mr. Linder.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 139.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 339.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/21/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.R. 2260 (promoting pain management and palliative care without permitting assisted suicide and euthanasia).
